comments.author: A2-
comments.body: Thanks for the recommendation for Tilt Bar. Been there today and having lots of fun. Due to the pandemic only the retro console tables in the booths are in operation. Buy tokens at the bar.

comments.author: retiredslacker01
comments.body:
We’re visiting for 13 nights in June/July. Thinking of splitting 4 nights Oslo; 3 nights city B; 3 nights city C; 3 nights Oslo with cities B and C a few hours by train. Does this make sense? If so, what are good options for cities B and C? 

Middle aged men who like to do walking tours and chill in interesting places. 

Does it make more sense to stay the entire time in Oslo and add day trips?

comments.body: has anyone taken their pcr test or know someone who did at radisson blu plaza with klinnik spero? how long did it take for you to get your results?thanks

comments.author: EasyWanderer
comments.body: Great tips, thanks for the info. I just arrived today and this help getting around in the city, planning where to go/when to go. One tip from me, always check bus vs train prices at the airport. Surprisingly train was cheaper than bus today and much faster, didn’t understand why but not gonna question something good :) That dessert soft-is is very delicious, I would recommend everyone to try

comments.author: None
comments.body: The Airport Express buses are back up and running. They can be very useful if you're going to somewhere not Oslo Central Station. The cost is 199 for a single ticket, or 349 if you buy a return (valid for exchange within 30 days, and each ticket is redeemable for any departure on your chosen date)

comments.author: Criticalan99
comments.body: Found some cheep Ryanair tickets for Oslo Torp so I'm planning on visiting Oslo. Since I'm from coming from Croatia (not a wealthy country) what are you recommendations. Can I have a normal touriat trip or is Oslo too expensive?
